Params[3]: The storm continues. Endless rainfall has reduced visibility to a minimum...
But the most terrifying fact is that the number of Hetero-Creatures has not reduced at all. They seem to be as endless as the rain... and equally ruthless.
No matter how many Hetero-Creatures we have killed, the next wave always comes straight away... Are they really not afraid to die?

Not much different. We can forget about taking back the defense positions... In fact, the Red Tide keeps approaching the coastline along with the rainfall and waves. Our flanks have moved back almost 200 meters...
The defense can hardly be maintained if the forces retreat even further. It was only established in a rush, and will not take long to be breached.
The east side is not looking good... Kamui, I and the Purifying Force can barely manage the Hetero-Creatures that broke through the Omega Weapon defense, but...
Another Omega Weapon is failing... Captain! Help me!
Chrome strives to freeze a few Hetero-Creatures approaching the defense. Kamui immediately smashes them into fragments with his greatsword.
Still, their attempts seem futile. A lot of Hetero-Creatures have brought the Red Tide into the beach through the breach.

Enduring the corrosion of high-density Punishing Virus, a Purifying Force soldier has installed the Omega Weapon that took a lot of effort to be shipped here, reinforcing the defense that has almost collapsed. Wanshi pulls him back just in time. He quickly checks the soldier and shakes his head.
Not good... The infection is almost reaching the threshold. I need to fall back and give him first-aid to contain the infection.
The Purifying Force soldier trembles from agony, but he never makes a sound.
Okay, Kamui... Take Wanshi's position for now...
Got it!
Remember, don't change the shooting parameters of my rifle...
Chrome slicks his hair back for better vision in the downpour. He looks back at the terminal.
Sorry, Commandant... I think I don't need to tell you the situation. The Omega Weapons are consumed way faster than we expected. We are still severely short of hands to set up defense.
Teddy takes off her headphones. Watching the changing numbers, she connects to Karenina's terminal.
Oi, Karenina! We still have a lot of Omega Weapon reserve, right? Can we send them here in time...?
No bloody way, thanks to this stupid weather... The truck can't drive through a lot of sand. We have to manually send Omega Weapons to the frontline. We are severely short of hands!

Controlling the gravity nearby, Karenina carries the container with more than 10 Omega Weapons inside all by herself and runs to the frontline. Still, the Omega Weapons are being consumed way faster than they are supplied.

As the Red Tide continues to invade, the line of defense will only extend. The available forces are also being compromised by the Red Tide and Hetero-Creatures... The lack of manpower will only worsen over time.
Just a little longer, Commandant... Another squad is on its way.
One squad is nowhere near enough, but at least it could buy the wounded soldiers some time to recover.

Params[2]: Good news... Which squad is that?

Params[3]: It's Commandant Simon's Dark Aries. They just finished restructuring though.

Params[2]: They can be relied on indeed.
Never thought Commander Nikola would agree to send them in...

Params[3]: Are you talking about Dark Aries is supposed to be still in maintenance, or Noan's abnormality?

Params[4]: Simon's not feeling too well either.

Params[3]: He had his plans.
They are helping us, as long as they have come down to the surface.
Now isn't the time to care about these things—Simon said this himself.
Commandant, another wave of Hetero-Creature is coming. We need your order. This time... I'm afraid the attack scale is greater than ever.

Params[2]: Everyone, protect the Omega Weapons. Impact in 30 seconds!

Params[3]: Lucia stands in the center alongside her comrades, facing endless enemies. She draws her katana.
The Red Tide of despair is swarming over. Behind them is the battle-worn Earth. Nobody wants to take one more step back, for there is still hope in this land.
After escaping from Copperfield Aquarium, the survivors have returned to their camp.
Barely over 10 people in this organization called "Scarlet Revelation" have survived... They are lucky to be alive, but living in this world may just be another misfortune to them.
Ouch... Don't move...
The old refugee twitches in pain, almost causing Lillian's serum to drop.
I'm sorry... Oh, God...
The agony has taken away the refugee's sanity. Severe Punishing Virus infection has left festering wounds all over his body.
Another female Construct is leaning on the wall, watching him apathetically.
She cannot understand. Dark Aries' top priority is supposed to be helping the coastline, yet Commandant Simon just makes them wait here.
Don't waste serum on him. The infection is out of control. Even if we save him, we can't keep the limbs.
Palma takes the remaining serum from Lillian.
Let's go. We have more urgent missions.
But... He's in pain...
I can give him relief.
Palma raises her hand. Before she swings the arm blade, a dagger suddenly strikes at her from behind.
But she is able to react and immediately steps aside before it hits her.
Good reflexes.
Maintaining a defensive stance, Palma looks up, only to find the bold attacker to be the leader of the Forsaken.
What's going on, Watanabe?
Hearing the incident, Noan and Commandant Simon of Dark Aries rush in and see the two confronting each other.
Forsaken... Noan? What on earth are you doing?
Watanabe, this is Captain Palma of Dark Aries.
A captain who kills refugees?
There must be some misunderstanding.
Misunderstanding? How about you explain first why you are with the Forsaken?
Will you believe me if I say it was just a coincidence?
Oh, so you made us wait at the door for you to bump into him "coincidentally"?
It was actually Lee's advice. Of course, Commander Nikola also gave his tacit consent—the Gray Raven Commandant knew the Forsaken would be coming to help and wanted us to meet him here.
What? Lee? He asked you to meet the Forsaken?
Yep. I knew Watanabe before I became a Construct. Gray Raven just happened to know it, too.
...With the Forsaken?
Right now, I think more help is always appreciated. We may have different beliefs, but our goals are the same.
...Tsk.
Captain Palma, can you pass that serum to me?
Palma reluctantly tosses the serum to Noan. He and Watanabe hold the trembling old refugee together and give him the injection.
Seeing this, Scarlet Revelation's leader Grace walks over and bows to thank them.
No matter what, I must thank you for doing this for him. May God's blessing guide your way.
God...
Watanabe looks at the Gurkha knife in his hand. He can never forget his friend, Bruce, who died in a church on the snowfield.

God created humans, but also the Punishing Virus. It twisted the will of the devout, trampled the resolve of the brave, and ultimately destroyed the faith of the kind-hearted, leaving only endless suffering to mankind.
Instead of believing in the words of a "god"... I would rather believe the will of "humans."
Of course. It's just my personal habit.
Habit...? Do you really believe in that god?
I believe in everything that we can rely and hope on... Be it God, divination or the Red Tide.
Or, the person that can become our hope...
Hah, you are so miserable. "Scarlet Revelation"? You are not even fanatic believers. You may as well call yourself the Church of "Anybody Help Me".
Why didn't you fight for it earlier?
Fight? Of course we want to fight...!
Look at our powerless hands, and these bodies of flesh that cannot be turned into Constructs. We were not chosen! All we could do was to be crushed into pieces by those monsters!
All we could do was to keep running away. We were sick of being drenched in fear, and hated our incapability!
All those emotions had turned into a hatred that could not be let out. This faith is the only thing we can rely on!
But...
If the contamination of the ocean will reduce our living space even further.
I would rather bet this life—that can be lost any time—on this opportunity, to unleash our fury that originated from fear.
...Do your believers also think that way?
No, some are unable to understand... But I told them it was a test that God gave us.
Besides, we have his promise. If this battle is a success, we can have our new future.
Who is he...? Oh, must be Noan. He always likes to use his hope to persuade others.
No, not me. It was Watanabe.
I'm but a Construct in Babylonia with no right to make decisions. How can I make a promise about someone else's future?
Fine, whatever. But...

Commandant Simon, Noan, you don't need to avoid me and go the long way the next time you want to seek external help. I may have worked in the Purifying Force... But I won't attack a Forsaken at this point of time.
She puts away the weapon and leaves.
...Noan.
What's the matter?
Nothing. I'm just not used to this name of yours. When you were introduced to me, I never thought "Shrek" could be a fake name.
He frowns at the young male Construct.
When I bid farewell to you on the train... I thought it was the end. I thought I just lost another Forsaken comrade.
Well, at least you're still alive. You can always come to the Forsaken if Babylonia doesn't want you.
I can't unhear that, Watanabe.
It's okay, Commandant Simon. I won't go back to the Forsaken. Given the connection between me and the Ascendants, I would only bring danger to Watanabe.
It's your future. You decide it.
Shall we just keep following, Yata?
What else can we do? My order is to observe Dark Aries and monitor their contact with the Forsaken.
Observe...? I thought we were watching over them.
There's no need to send them to the surface just for that purpose.
As long as there is nothing abnormal, we will just follow them and join the battle. Our priority is to assist the combatants.
Harley Jo has received the latest update on his terminal. He quickly finishes reading it and frowns.
What's the matter?
Gray Raven just reported a large number of Hetero-Creatures attacking the defense. There's no time... We must go now.
Simon has probably got the message too.
It's sent to all commandants, of course he will get it. See, they are already preparing to head out.
...Alright. Let's go.
A raindrop falls on Yata's mask. She looks up at the muddy sky.
...The storm is coming.
Lady Revelationist! Are we really going to follow their truck and fight so many monsters...?
Of course. That is God's revelation.
Remember what I told you?
This is... a test...
Correct. My divination had also shown the same conclusion. We will be victorious.
Really? If the Revelationist also says so, we will be fine!
Let's go together!
Yeah!
The divination or so-called "revelation" may all be a lie. Still, it can inspire the crowd at this very moment.
Our hearts are so fragile and sensitive. There is nothing "perfect" about them, but...
That's why we need each other, and a faith. We need someone to tell us... That tomorrow will be better.

After the most fierce wave of Hetero-Creature attack, the coastline defense is once again in a stalemate. The only difference is that each move of Hetero-Creature is slowly but surely eroding the human's battle line.

Thanks to the support of the Purifying Force, the Omega Weapon defense on the west side can be barely maintained. But the east side, with relatively weaker strength, is on the brink of total collapse.

The battle was meant to be a small defensive operation, but before anyone realized, it has turned into a large-scale trench warfare. The beach is totally exposed and lacks cover. Soldiers can only rely on the Omega Weapons in front to shield themselves.
But when the supplies cannot keep up with the consumption, all the effort will end up in vain...

Commandant... Only 30% of the Omega Weapon defense on the east side is operational. Strike Hawk plans to launch a quick assault with the less wounded soldiers of the Purifying Force. Hope we can take back the battle line...

Params[2]: No... Abandon the east side. Let's fall back.

Params[3]: Why, Commandant?! If we do that...
Chrome pats on Kamui's back and shakes his head. He just stares at the battle-worn Purifying Force soldiers.
Even if we take the line back... We may not make it out of here. Besides, we don't have enough hands to redeploy the Omega Weapons.

Params[2]: Correct. Maybe the only option we have is to let them spread on the land...

Params[3]: Holding the battle line may result in a great loss... It is more sensible to keep the strength and wait for an opportunity to strike back.
If only there is one more squad, you can attack the Hetero-Creatures' flanks when they enter the valley on the coastline.
Your terminal suddenly receives some noise. The signal comes from the east side, near Strike Hawk.
...Alright, the interference is gone. All comms back to normal!
Hehe, I would love to chat with you, Chief. But I will leave it to Dark Aries to do the talking. They were the first to depart and should not be too far away from you.
Greetings, Commandant. We decided to come first.
Commandant Simon was supposed to do the briefing, but he was a little car-sick. Lillian's taking care of him.

Apart from the 4 members of Dark Aries, there is Yata from Scarab, and Commandant Harley Jo from Woodcock... As well as 37 from the Forsaken, including Watanabe. A total of 43 combatants are moving to help with the coastline defense, where the Red Tide is.

Params[2]: The Forsaken... Watanabe is here too!

Params[3]: You nod to Teddy. She opens the tactical map and locates the coordinates of the east side's breach.

Params[2]: Please move to the area between MN-6 and MN-8 and intercept the flank of Hetero-Creatures.

Params[3]: Alright.

Params[2]: Also, help Strike Hawk to organize a counterattack if possible.

Params[3]: No problem.
Still, I need to remind you. Based on the calculation of my program, even with the extra dozens of combatants, the Omega Weapon defense won't sustain prolonged operation.
We have more than that.
Yes.
Noan looks behind himself at the horizon with a little eagerness. The sky is full of dark clouds, but he knows that is also where the Sun rises.
They are here, too.
Following Noan's vision, you also look back toward the end of the valley that leads to the coastline. Under the sunlight bordering the dark clouds, you see many moving figures.
The leader holds her twisted steel staff high. Following her, many more are charging toward the coastline defense.
God has always been guiding us. In the past, he gave us many trials... But also redemption. He kept us alive. We have transcended the trials to prove that we are the chosen ones.
Grace points her staff at the endless Hetero-Creatures on the coastline.
His enemies now stand before us. This is a fight we must take on, and we shall end it once and for all. Now take your weapons and follow me!
The crowd makes a thundering cheer. More refugees have shown up at the end of the vision, rushing toward the coastline wielding all sorts of weapons that they got from the Forsaken.

Such is the fury of all the "cowards" that originated from their fear, and the courage that units them all together. They may be insignificant, but right now, they have the strength to shake the sky and the sea!
Individually, the refugees aren't that strong. But their number can really help the shipment of Omega Weapons.
Right. The victory of this battle, as well as our lives and future... We are all counting on you, Commandant.

Params[2]: I shall make decisions with even greater caution.

Params[3]: I believe in you. "If it's Chief, everything will be alright."
All sorts of... legends?
Noan smiles, as if he is saying this as an encouragement.

Params[2]: The east side defense has been breached by Hetero-Creatures.
Even with Dark Aries and the Forsaken, we won't be able to take it back in a short time.
Getting the refugees involved on the surface at this point of time...
I'm afraid it will result in many casualties.

Params[3]: I see. Is there any other way?
Yes, Commandant.

Params[2]: Can you spare us one ship from the ARU?

Params[3]: Sure. The storm has calmed a lot, so the pressure we're facing on the sea has significantly reduced.
Wait a minute, are you trying to get the refugees to the east via the sea? Wouldn't that be more dangerous...
Teddy suddenly stops talking. She thinks again.
Actually, no. The Hetero-Creatures may come from the sea, but most of them are moving to the coastline through the bottom. There aren't many of them on the sea surface.

Params[2]: Correct. The place that looks the most dangerous often turns out to be the safest.

Params[3]: I don't see any problems with that. The ARU will send the fastest ship to pick up the refugees at the port.

Params[2]: Still, someone needs to cover them on their way to the port.

Params[3]: Commandant, please let me go.
Hearing your conversation, Liv walks into the temporary command center. She was treating the wounds of an injured Purifying Force member.
I can deal with a small number of Hetero-Creatures myself... Besides, if any of them gets injured, I can provide timely treatment.

Liv places a hand on her chest. She looks determined... Unlike the past when she seemed to be forcing herself, the decision she has made now is based on her confidence established from numerous battles. You can trust her unconditionally.

Params[2]: Alright, I'll leave it to you... All the best.

Params[3]: Sure. I'll do my best.
Liv smiles and salutes, then quickly walks out of the command center.
The giant humanoid continues to move closer, slowly but surely. She has the shape of a female human, but also has many obvious traits of a Hetero-Creature...
No matter what, you can only maintain the defense and hope the Omega Weapons will work to stop her before the coastline.
